Rex’s Earthship in Taos was a magical escape. When we arrived, Rex greeted us with enthusiasm then he gave us a tour and some fun facts about the space. The evenings were cozy within the Earthship, we had mostly homemade meals and enjoyed watching snowflakes land on the big picture-frame windows looking out toward the mountains and a wide-open sky. We spent time every day and night outside to look at the expansive mountain landscape around us, taking the telescope outside to the platform that Rex built and got to look up at the moon and even see Jupiter and its moons. The Earthship was a perfect warm and cozy home to curl up and read a book, work on art, and play cards. We hiked at the Rio Grande Gorge, an easy 20-minute drive west, and left our dogs in the Earthship to soak up the sunbeams warming the house. We were not ready to leave.
Thank you, Rex! The Earthship was a beautiful cabin escape in the desert!
What a unique experience it was to stay in this beautiful earthship! We can’t wait to be back. Rex is a great host and the place is carefully filled with everything we’d need.
Really unique spot in with beautiful stars and 360 degree views right outside the house. Loved the stay and the host was great. Will be back.

Got to live the dream of staying in an earthship... Rex was a geat host and was readily available to our needs. TV wasn't working and he purchased a new one the next day ...!!! If you want to stay in an earthship this is a great one !!

Rex's earthship dwelling was really interesting and cool! We rested well in the comfy beds and enjoyed looking at other earthship houses in the area. My son & daughter in law loved the deep tile tub.
Rex was super responsive & an excellent host. Everything was clean & we enjoyed the unique experience.

We loved our stay at the earthship. It was easy to find and Rex was super friendly and responsive to any questions. Words can't describe the beauty of the property and surroundings. We really enjoyed our walks and stargazing at night was quite a spectacular experience. We are so happy to have stayed there and highly recommend it!
Rex was a great host. There were many special touches at this fabulous spot. Highly recommended
Such a special place to stay. Rex was so kind upon check-in and gave us the privacy desired during our stay. This place is magical and we can’t wait to come back.
Beautiful way to experience an Earthship while visiting Taos. Very cozy.
Very fun and interesting get away! As a native New Mexican, I always wanted to spend the night in an earth ship. It was a unique experience.

A neat unique spot and Rex was really easy to coordinate with. The place had all I needed and quality items in the kitchen, bath and bedroom. Some favorite aspects: the double headed shower, the comfortable mattress and bedding, the kitchen table during the day, with the light coming in through the windows. It was kind of amazing that it snowed outside and the temperature stayed even and cozy inside, without the need to turn on a heater. Very cool design, these earthships. This was my first experience with one. The only drawbacks that seem to be due to the nature of earthships in general: I am a wee skittish of bugs, so I escorted some out, and would have liked a bit more curtain to pull over the large windows at night, but otherwise was delighted with the stay.
So fun to stay in the earth ship. Beautiful home outside of Taos.

This earthship is amazing. It’s beautiful, cozy, sustainable, and just plain cool! It’s secluded on a dirt road. The sunset and stars are unbelievable. The design details in the house make you want to never leave.
Wifi is strong in the living room but spotty in the back bedroom.
Place stayed warm from the sun even though it was cold at night.
No complaints. 100% recommend

Rex was a magnificent host and we would definitely recommend the earthship. It’s cozy and charming and well-decorated. Rex was very easy to get a hold of, helpful and accommodating. Beds are comfy and the bathtub is spectacular. The best part of the stay, however, is the sunsets! Gorgeous view. Hope to be back soon.

Highly recommended to anyone looking for a really cool experience. Awesome home in a very secluded and quiet location. Got up early each morning to watch the sunrise and take photos of the starry skies.
Rex was an excellent host, the place was exactly as described and was such a unique experience.

We enjoyed our time at Rex's home. We did need to review Rex's directions because GPS gets close but it was not accurate. We loved looking at the sky at night from our beds. The home is convenient to town and was comfortable.
Rex’s earthship is a really beautiful and unique place to stay. The views are incredible. This was my second time there and both experiences were wonderful.
We loved our one night stay in the earthship. Beautiful views in every direction, a comfortable stay, a different kind of experience that is a highlight of our trip to New Mexico
such a beautiful space, Rex was a great host. would like to return!
Beautiful, truly unique stay -- we loved our time in this earthship!
A beautiful natural setting with a starry night sky and very comfortable beds.

A very unique and fabulous stay, with easy access to Taos. Rex was a great host and made check in a breeze. 360 degree views and we could see the Milky Way in the sky each night! Lots of local wildlife, too.
Even with below 40 degree temps at night, the Earthship stayed HOT. By the second night we figured out to keep all the windows open and fans on, even though outdoors was quite chilly. All part of the fascinating technology that is an Earthship, but if you think you may want to close some windows at night -- don't. Think of it as being more connected to nature, just keep the screens closed or you'll be inviting nature in :)
Great location with views of the mountains just outside. Earthen brown adobe walls and Saltillo floors make it charming.
Great place to stay. Rex was a fine host, great communication and hands off in a good way. The house got a little warm in the afternoons, but cooled down in the evening. Fun place and a fun stay.
We had a great stay at the earthship may do again when we’re back in Taos.
Peaceful beautiful place to stay with great host Stars were beautiful and it was really nice to see how the Earthships feel. Good location for exploring area. Very comfortable for a group of 4.
Great spot! Super cute.
Such a special place - never been anywhere quite like it and probably never will again! A great base to explore Taos - or just read books in one of the property's many cosy chairs.
Great, cute, earthen home styled after the famous "Earthship" as designed by Michael Reynolds. A wonderful get away- great for a couple, or a family!

Cozy, beautiful and one of a kind! Rex provided all the amenities needed and was helpful and communicative.
Breathtaking views of the stars and night sky from every room!

Rex's place was great and his instructions were super helpful in finding it! I will note this is an older-style earthship without the cooling tubes, so ventilating the place required us to open up all the windows and the front door. Additionally, the place is due for a deep clean just being in a dusty desert environment. Loved the experience of staying in an earthship though and Rex was a super-responsive host!
A unique and inspirational property. Fascinating inside, and surrounded by lovely mountain views.

Our one night stay in Rex’s earth ship was delightful. He was easy to communicate with, directions were easy to follow and the views are spectacular! Such a unique stay and would love to visit again soon.
Rex is a great host and will bend over backwards to make you feel at home.

We had an amazing time staying in Rex’s Earthship! The house exceeded expectations, with its two bedrooms, excellent furnishings, and a fully stocked kitchen. I initially had concerns about finding the place, but Rex’s instructions made it exceedingly simple. We’d stay again in a heartbeat!

This is a magical place to stay. There are certain quirks about being in an earthship (weird water pipe noises, full moon through the skylights in your face while sleeping) but if you are prepared for them, there is scarcely a more relaxing place to be.

We loved our visit to the Earthship, which was very sunny, quiet, and comfortable. The restaurants mentioned in another review, Medley and Farmhouse Cafe, were both wonderful! As you approach the Earthship on Sugar Lane, look for a small street sign labeled Pyramid Way--that's the final bit of road to travel to your destination. We took a walk around the neighborhood, and found a number of other earthships, a pyramid (!!) and a castle. Quite a place!

Was a very unique, eccentric and beautiful place! Rex was friendly, cool and helpful. The huge windows, lush plants inside the Earthship, telescope, and vast views made it a memorable experience. My only concern was the dustiness and it was pretty warm in the middle of summer. Highly recommend if you want a hippie-esque, marvelous experience.
Great space and great stay!

I enjoyed my stay at this private Earthship near Blueberry Hill (not to be confused with the Earthship Biotecture community beyond the Gorge bridge). It was very comfortable, other than a bit hot at night for sleeping despite the many fans. It had all of the amenities a kitchen could possibly have for cooking meals. Once you find the place it is an easy drive to town because Taos just really is not that big! But oh-so-beautiful!!!!
Unique stay

My partner, my dog and I just stayed at Rex's place for the second time, and we absolutely plan to come back. It is the perfect weekend getaway from city life, a cozy and peaceful escape where you can enjoy the silence and serenity of the desert. Rex's house has the feel of being private and rural despite being in a neighborhood (the houses are spaced pretty far apart), and we loved sitting outside with our coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, enjoying the quiet, taking in the beautiful mountain views, and admiring at the stars at night (there is a telescope in the house!). Rex's place is stocked with all of the essentials, and you feel immediately at home. Our dog loved it here as well, but a quick note that there are some neighborhood dogs that paid us a visit and we weren't sure if they were friendly, so just be alert/aware if you bring your pup as well. If you are looking for an earthship experience, you won't be disappointed with this place. Local recommendations: try the Farmhouse Cafe for brunch and Medley for dinner (both in El Prado); we had some fantastic meals here! I also recommend taking a walk through the neighborhood around the house as there are some very cool structures.
A tad warm at night in June but it’s still incredibly comfy and cool.
Peaceful and quiet!
If you are on this area and can book the Earthship, you will not be disappointed.
A very cool experience! Enjoy your time lounging in the desert and just enjoy the quiet, amazing star gazing, and a super rad home!
Unique and lovely place, spectacular sunset view and stars. Really enjoyed the experience.

Rex's place is exactly as described! It has everything you need, in quiet location with amazing open views, while still being convenient to area attractions. i was impressed by the plants inside! I would definitely recommend!
The earthship was a great experience. Rex, our host, was always available. The place was very clean and had everything we needed. Outstanding views!!!

Loved my stay at the earthship! Stayed for a short time during a New Mexico road trip. LOVED the location. Short drive to the main Taos plaza but remote enough that you could appreciate the desert splendor. Woke up early and could hear (and see) the wildlife. The washer/dryer was an especially welcome perk after our hikes. The place itself is well equipped and felt like I was being welcomed into someone’s home- cozy, comfortable, and inviting. Would definitely stay here again, for a longer time, to truly experience New Mexico life.
We only stayed a night, but it was a unique experience and gave the kids something I think they'll remember for years to come. Everyone should experience an Earthship at some point.

We only stayed for 1 night, but the house is pretty cool! I was kinda expecting to be able to see the stars from the inside, or lay under the large windows, but it isn't really set up like this. The stars are super visible to admire from the outside area, but the outside area wasn't quite as peaceful as I had expected. There are houses close by, including the owners (i assume) which is very close & it was a bit noisy (mainly neighbor dogs barking, couldn't hear them from the inside). Overall we had a great stay & Rex was responsive & it was great we were able to take our dogs with us for the stay. Maybe just a little on the expensive side for what the stay & area are.
Great views & comfy interior.

I stayed one night at Rex's earthen home. It is an older design Earthship, so does not have more fine-tuned temperature control. There are not cooling tubes, and the greenhouse is not separated by a second glass wall. That said, when I got there in the afternoon, it was warm, but not too bad. There are fans, but I didn't need them, because it cooled down well in the evening. Having the plants (huge succulents!!) in the house seemed to make a very pleasant atmosphere and aroma. I would gladly stay there again if the opportunity arose!
An incredible earthship experience for anyone. Even though I only stayed one night, definitely an adventure I will be telling friends and family for years to come.

We had a lovely stay at Rex’s Earthship. Very comfortable and surprisingly stayed a comfortable temperature the entire time! Beautiful wood beams, and loved the whole vibe. Would definitely stay again. Thank you!
Such a lovely stay!

Amazing Earthship, so peaceful and quiet and completely private! The views are amazing and the property itself is really well equipped but still retains that authentic Earthship experience. We loved our stay and would have loved to have stayed longer!
Very cozy, relaxing, and BEAUTIFUL. We had a lot on our schedule and I wish we would have had more time to sit and relax. But when we were there it was wonderful and easy. Thank you, Rex!

Our time at Rex’s earthship was incredible. I felt like I was on another planet. Thankfully this other worldly place has great internet, is super comfortable and clean. Highly recommend making some mystical memories here.
Great how and amazing place
If you are looking to the see the stars, be one with nature, chill out and align with the Taos vibe, this place is it! Rex is a fabulous host and you'll be so glad you booked a stay at his place!

Super quiet, beautiful scenery. If you have not had the opportunity to stay in the Earthship community, this is perfect. The home was easy to find, Kirsten has excellent instructions and wonderful recommendations for things to do and places to eat. After a day of sight-seeing and hiking, I loved sitting outside and watching the sunset.
Kristen and Ron are great. Their home was super unique. The surrounding area is beautiful. It is easy to get to Taos and various hiking trails.

magical place, we saw things we've never seen before and will be using bits and pieces of the house as a source of inspiration for our future home. we truly feel extremely privileged to have experienced Kirsten & husband's home and it's surroundings.
Beautiful! Great host and hope to get back ASAP!

Very cool place & area.
LOVED everything.
A special experience!
Wonderful opportunity to experience a self sustainable home!
Responsive host, super clean home, soft linens, great views.
We loved our stay in the earthship! The light-filled home is a beautiful place to watch the weather on the mesa and learn a little about this cleverly designed off-grid housing model.

This was our first time to stay in an earthship, and we were blown away! Such a wonderful experience. The house was clean and very comfortable. It felt very private, and the views of the sunrise and sunset each day were to die for. Kirsten was a fantastic host, and left easy to follow instructions for the off-grid systems. Would definitely stay here again!

Such a great weekend!! We ended up having to swap our dates because we got snowed in in Colorado but Kirsten was super communicative and understanding :) Definitely is a solid 20-25 minutes from downtown Taos, stars were beautiful and mountains were snowy. Bed was SO comfy. If you leave the sky light open in the bathroom it helps with the airflow :) the place had everything we needed! Keep in mind you can’t use blow dryers or curling irons if you’re planning to go to dinner or something. But the house felt very cozy and we even heard coyotes at night. The plants inside definitely bring in a few bugs but nothing too scary😂 very dog friendly, arrived to a full water bowl and some treats! Hard to navigate if we didn’t download the map on our iPhones before hand, no service without WiFi. But WiFi was great at the house! We both worked remotely for 2 days no issues :)

I saw the Earthship community this past summer and really wanted to stay in one. I'm so happy to have found Kirsten's. I was able to stay there with my dogs. Really incredible experience! I cannot get over how steady the climate inside stayed. The skies were cloudy and it snowed the two nights I was there. Temperatures at night were in the 20s and probably 40s during the day. The temperature inside was quite warmer than in my house. The Earthship felt so solid and cozy. The plumbing and electrical functioned like a normal house. Hopefully spring 2025 I will be building my own Earthship. Definitely recommend staying in one, and Kirsten was an outstanding host!!
Super lovely experience. Kirsten is a pro host for sure, and super responsive. Very cool and unique stay in the Earthship! So quiet and comfortable.

I dunno what to say--the pictures of this special home speak for themselves. STAY HERE if you have the opportunity to--it's a place you will never, ever forget. My partner and I went on a number of hikes in the area (30 minutes away or so) and loved the warm and down-to-earth folks of Taos. Wanted to move there.
Simply amazing. Perfect location for my ski trip and unlike any place I've ever stayed.

We had a magical two-day stay at the earthship, a one-of-a-kind experience. Walking in to see an indoor mini jungle was incredible, and we saw several coyote frens outside over the two days. It's dead silent in the area so sleep quality was great. Our host was very communicative and friendly, and instructions were super easy to follow. The earthship is only ~30 minutes from Taos which has easy groceries and restaurants, plus nearby attractions even if you aren't into hiking or skiing (such as seeing the Rio Grande bridge. The earthship is comfortable and cozy and even has bikes to ride, and a french press! Not unexpectedly, a passive home has certain operational requirements, for example it's not possible to use a hair dryer, and the stove was a bit difficult to use (even with instructions), so just go with the flow of being off the grid, as it's a wonderfully relaxing experience. Definitely recommend this spot.

Overall, I really enjoyed the space. It wasn't actually in El Prado, so expect to drive a little bit further from the main road through Taos. I was a little bummed I couldn't use my hair dryer (it could really hurt the solar powered system), but that's on me. I ended up having to wash my hair at my father-in-law's house.
But Kirsten was wonderful. The surroundings are beautiful. It's quiet and you can see ALL the stars at night. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone interested in experiencing an earthship. Thank you Kirsten!
Kirsten was friendly and very helpful. It was super cool to observe firsthand how the plants and systems were cultivated from what otherwise would be wasted.
Great place to stay! Loved staying in Kirsten’s Earthship. Cozy and convenient. Would definitely stay again.
Super cool house and very great surrounding views. Highly recommend!

It was such a dream come true to stay at Kirsten’s earthship. I loved the brilliant design of the structure and interior, the spaciousness, wonderful natural and interior light and spectacular scenery with the huge windows, superb kitchen, beautiful plants, “glass brick” wall design, cozy bed. I also loved learning about the earthships systems by getting to stay in one for a few days. Even in freezing temperatures, the place was warm thanks to its passive heating and cooling. There was even an option to compost too! I really appreciate the opportunity to experience the place that Kirsten designed and built. Thank Kirsten and Ron for hosting us!

This was our first time staying in an Earthship and it was a great stay. Communication and instructions were clear. They made it easy to understand the home and how to operate the various features of an Earthship. One thing to note is that there is no microwave or traditional coffee maker. Location is outside of town which adds to the experience. Kitchen had more than everything one needs to cook meals.

House was super private and unique. Host was very responsive and friendly even treated us to an Apple movie for Christmas. And yes, we watched the Grinch for 3.99$. Great place to take your dogs and get away in the mountains. The ski resort is only 30 minutes away and Taos is a lovely town! 10/10 would stay again.
Amazing experience!! Absolutely loved the area and the house and land is beautiful. Perfect place to stay! Thank you so much:)
amazing!
We loved staying at the earthship. Super unique and comfortable. Great place to get away and have some peace and quiet. We loved that we could bring our pups

We really enjoyed our time here. Staying in this earthship was a special and inspiring experience. The views from the place are incredible and the large windows allowed us to enjoy the scenery, sunrises, and stargazing while comfortable inside. The temperature inside was very comfortable, even when the overnight temps dropped down to the 20s or 30s outside. The location is convenient to Taos, very close to the gorge and lots of other fun places in the area. Highly recommended!

This place was a joy to stay at. Kristen was an excellent host. Instructions were clear and timely and the communication was prompt. The place was as described and as expected. This was a great AirBnB experience and I would definitely recommend to family and/or friends
Awesome experience! Definitely recommend!

Great experience in an Earthship. Well appointed, lovely extras such as creamers in refrigerator. Very helpful information about day to day living in an Earthship.
Be aware that GPS may be wonky as you get in the community.

Kirsten’s Earthship is absolutely gorgeous and beautifully built and designed. The surroundings are breathtakingly beautiful and peaceful. I had a wonderful experience staying there and enjoyed every element of it. Kirsten is very friendly, responsive, proactive with useful information, and there even is a great binder with information and recommendations. I would recommend this place to anyone that wants to try something different in a very peaceful and beautiful setting.

Really cool experience
Recommend to all
Check out visitors center

This is a beautiful place with amazing views. Both of us had to work during the week and had no issues with the Wi-Fi. The kitchen has all the cooking supplies needed. There are great views from every room and the place is so peaceful. One downside is that it is 25-30 minutes out of town which asked it hard to get to any of the shops before they all close. Overall it was a great stay and I’d stay again in a heart beat. Kirsten is an amazing host who goes out of her way to make your stay phenomenal.

The place is magical , the panoramic views, the silence , this house is beautiful and very special
It's very cute and clean
You feel embraced by the land
We loved it

First stay in an Earthship and our expectations were beyond exceeded! Considerate touches throughout the home for convenience, incredible views both day and night... plus restful sleep in the tucked-away bedroom. Look forward to another visit down the road.

Had a very enjoyable stay in Kirsten's earthship. Very peaceful and quiet, just what I was looking for! I had both hot and cool, wet weather during my stay and it was fun being in the earthship for this. It can get a tad warm when the temp is 90+ but Kirsten has fans that can be utilized and I was never uncomfortable. Loved that it was dog friendly and my dog, Cosmo, thoroughly enjoyed napping on the cool concrete floors and sniffing all the plants.

You have to experience this beautiful space to believe it. The clean lines, combined with adobe aesthetics work in harmony and complement the desert surroundings. This cannot be overstated.
Our experience was contemplative, awe inspiring and thought provoking.
The ship itself with the 180 degree view of the high desert and mountain ranges is the stuff of landscape paintings. From the kitchen table we could watch jack rabbits, quails, coyotes, double-rainbows and the occasional sagebrush tumble weed roll by.
Even the thunder storms that rolled through seemed like something out of cinema.
The instructions on operating all necessary vents and units were clear and easy to follow. The kitchen with its modern style complemented the adobe aesthetic of the structure.
I can’t say enough about the coolness factor. There are banana trees growing inside the house!
On the practical side we were always comfortable and Taos was a very easy and short drive to galleries
and restaurants.
I had a great stay in Kristen’s earthship! I’d definitely stay there again.

Staying in Kristen's Earthship was a dream! We had 3 inspired and productive working days in the space with incredible views, comfortable surroundings, and fast Wi-Fi! Staying in this fully self-reliant home showed us what was possible in terms of sustainable living, but it also felt really comfortable, easy, and modern. Kristen was super responsive and helpful, making sure we were comfortable throughout our stay. This was one of our favorite AirBNB experiences! We would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an inspiring space to work, a peaceful place to disconnect, or a home base to explore Taos.
This is the second time we stayed here and we love it. Even very unusually hot weather it was comfortable. The setting is so beautiful and peaceful.
Nice to be outside of town. Easy bike ride to gorge viewpoint and through Earthship neighborhood.

The place was amazing! We did not want to leave!
Even though it was only 15 minutes from town, it felt like we had left the planet and sailed away to another world far far away. Maybe that is why they are called Earthships?
We loved the storms that passed through, and cooking on while looking out over the mountains was so enjoyable.
Everything worked perfectly, the Apple TV, the Wi-Fi, the Bluetooth speaker, the stove. Everything was easy to use and in great condition.
The outside furniture was very clean and comfortable. We loved having dinners at sunset looking at the birds and the majestic view of the mountains.
We road our bikes through the community and made memories that we will never forget.
We were so lucky to get to stay in Kirsten’s home!

Wow, that was the most memorable AirBnB experience of our lives! We feel so lucky to have been able to stay in such a unique house, and we're honestly thinking about building our own earthship because it had such an impact on us. Kirsten and her partner did an amazing job refurbishing this place and decorating it really tastefully. It's SOOOO quiet in the house and outside the house, it was so cool being able to see the stars and lightning from the skylight in the bedroom, and the feel of the house is just so cozy. Other than the lovely vibe of the house, it was clean, had everything we needed, and we couldn't have asked for a better stay. Kirsten was proactive with instructions about everything. The place is only about 15 minutes from Taos, so we were able to do all the town things and then escape to this little place when we were done. Highly recommend.

Kristen’s place was amazing! We had such a great experience staying here. Everything was as described, and it is such a beautiful home. The views were absolutely breathtaking! It was such a great way to get away. We stayed during a heat warning in the area but had no issues with the inside staying cooler. Kristen was very responsive, helpful, and accommodating; a fantastic host! We can’t wait to come back!

This place is beyond relaxing with a gorgeous 360° views. We will recommend this place and surely come back.
Note to everyone: this is middle of nowhere, in a way. There are wild animals and critters. Enjoy every single creature or insect you see! House was safe and beautiful, though!! Great stay.

Loved it ! It did get a little warm and stuffy - but the temps outside were in the 90's. So, even without A/C, it was pretty comfortable.
The birds outside love to congregate on the metal table and chairs which make them too dirty to use. But, hey it's nature! We just moved the lightweight chairs to that area to sit. Just don't blame the host for the bird's mess!
And the bikes were a great touch, fun to pedal around the community.
Overall, it was a great experience. The scenery was so quiet, beautiful and peaceful. So relaxing after a hectic 2 day drive.
Even better than expected.

Beautiful area outside Taos, peaceful and you can see the sunset and stars at night. A perfect way to spend a low key vacation! We loved staying at the earthship, which was a new experience for us. Everything was as described and the view was breathtaking. The instructions on operating everything was clear. We’d definitely stay here again!

We had an amazing stay in Kirsten’s earth ship. It made our stay in Taos feel so magical and the home itself was beautiful and warm. Everything was easy to manage and it wasn’t too far from anything with the added bonus of passing over the Rio Grande every time we went into town!

It was a pleasure to have a chance to stay in an earth home. We enjoyed the feeling and location of this abode. The night is fantastic!
We had a situation and it was handled immediately. Thank you so much for our visit.

Absolutely incredible. I stayed in Kirsten's Earthship with my dog Luna and it was exactly what we were looking for. Private, beautiful surroundings, only a 25 minute drive into town and only 30 minutes from Ojo Caliente. It was exceptionally clean and nicely decorated. Staying in an earthship itself was quite the experience and really makes me rethink how I live my life!!
We loved the Earthship, we want one of our own now! What a beautiful place to live! We felt very lucky to have gotten to spend our weekend in this beautiful home in a perfect location.

Our stay was amazing! The place is beautiful and such an amazing opportunity. Kirsten and her husband were very helpful and responsive when we had issues. The beauty was astounding and we felt so lucky to be able to stay right in the earthship community!
Beautiful place and location! Such a cool house and overall experience. Everything was clean and had everything we needed.

Kirsten’s earthship was one of the coolest places we have ever stayed at. We honestly didn’t want to leave to explore Taos just because we wanted to hang out at the house. The view over the mesa and of the mountains is absolutely unreal. It’s about 20 minutes from Taos Plaza and just 5 minutes from the Rio Grande Gorge Bridge. Kirsten was very communicative and provided some great snacks both for us and our pup! We absolutely loved our stay in this unique and sustainable home.

This was my first time taking myself on an artist’s retreats and this property was exactly what I needed. Peaceful and the surroundings were stunning. Easily one of the best airbnb experiences i’ve had.

It was an interesting experience staying in an Earthship home!! What a lovely stay we had. The other homes in the area were beautiful and the location in Taos was breathtaking. We saw some hot air balloons, while enjoying a hot cup of chai. This place was cozy, and the instructions were very clear. We brought our dog, and he had a fun time too! I would say make sure you bring wipes for your dog, because it’s very dusty outside. I would stay here again! We really enjoyed ourselves :)

Kirsten’s Airbnb earth ship was a beautiful and wonderful experience to behold! There’s simply not much like it and would recommend visiting the Earthship visitor’s center nearby to learn and appreciate their beauty!
Kirsten’s instructions for everything between check in and check out were thorough, clear, and easy to follow and was much appreciated!
The place is very well kept and we had live nothing but praise! Thanks again!
Such a fun and unique stay! Would definitely recommend!

Staying here was such a great experience - and a wonderful surprise for my husband who has been interested in earthships since the 70's. It's a beautiful place to clear the head - lots of space and light. A unique experience with everything one could possibly need. Loved it!
what a great place!!!

This is our 2nd stay at one of Kirsten’s homes because it never disappoints. It’s the most beautiful, peaceful and amazing experience to stay in an EarthShip and Kirsten is a phenomenal host. Everything was immaculate with special personal touches and communication with Kirsten was always prompt and helpful. It was a another wonderful experience and we will be back!

Staying in Kirsten’s Earthship was the highlight of our trip! We were in Taos for our honeymoon and it was the perfect getaway after a very busy week. Waking up to the mountains and going to sleep with millions of stars was incredible. The space was spotless walking in and she even had little extra amenities like coffee and cream. Kirsten was extremely helpful when we messaged her. 10/10 recommend staying in this Earthship!

We loved our stay at Kirsten’s place. The home is gorgeous and unique. I enjoyed opening the blinds in the morning and drinking my coffee with a view! Never had to turn on the heater as the home does retain heat well. It’s in a great location to downtown taos and the ski valley. Would definitely recommend!
Amazing place. Perfect getaway.

I think this was maybe my favorite Airbnb that I’ve ever stayed in! The earthship is very well equipped and has everything you need. We were even able to work from there and take video calls. Would definitely come back!

I cannot say enough good things about this place and our time there!!! It looked exactly like the pictures- waking up with that view of the plants and the landscape outside was one of my favorite parts. We enjoyed the home and going into town/ Taos. Our time there was very relaxing and we had everything we needed. We reached out to the host who was very responsive and quick to help! We were so sad to have overcast evenings and no sight of stars- so we hope to return again to get the full experience! This place was one of our favorite airbnb stays of all time!!! I wouldn't hesitate to book it.

Perfect peaceful getaway for my fiancé and I. Being a fully self sustaining home was amazing to experience. Our dog loved it as well. She had all the kitchen necessities and more. She responded to every question we had. Would 100% recommend this place to anyone.
Great space with beautiful views, rare opportunity to stay in an off-grid earth ship!

This was both mine and my wife's first stay in an earth-ship home and was an incredible experience. The area was very peaceful and serene with friendly neighbors whom I rarely encountered. From the booking process to checkout everything went totally smooth. Will absolutely book with Kirsten again if I ever find myself in Taos again for the winter.

Very unique stay in an earthship. It was very cold and cloudy wintery weather when we were there so we did have to turn on the propane heaters for a couple of hours, but otherwise the passive heating made it a cozy place to watch the snow over the mountains. Incredible views.

Lovely stay. As some reviewers have mentioned there is no heat, but ample propane heaters provided for our February stay. This really is a wild place to stay, with coyotes, jack rabbits, and lots of small burrowing mammals. You may want ear plugs as the vent above the bed can be a little noisy if windy - but we only experienced this one night of our stay for an hour or two while a storm was blowing over. Easy drive to Ojo Caliente and everything in Taos.
Such a unique and fun place to stay! My husband and I skied and we enjoyed the retreat away from the rest of the world!

Kirsten was a wonderful host! Very responsive, with a very thorough binder with all of the information needed for our stay. The home was a beautiful, relaxing, peaceful space. It was a unique experience that we would recommend to anyone!

Kirsten is incredible. This Earthship was built by her in stages, over years, and she lived in it before deciding to share it with the world! The TLC is clear. I had toured an Earthship but never stayed in one, and the aura, the lighting, the *smell* from the plants, the room temperature even in winter, all surpassed expectations, even for this New Mexican! I went up for a birthday weekend, and Kirtsen was so generous as to leave little welcome gifts for me and my dog 💖💖. Not only that, but this is the PERFECT retreat after skiing (which we did) and a day at Ojo Caliente (which we did). Let Taos and the mesa seep into your soul ✌

Jaw dropping the entire time. From the amazing views to the innovative features of this home, our stay was 10/10. Couldn’t recommend more to someone looking to get away and experience this unique community
Kirsten's Earthship was a beautiful, unique place to stay. Definitely a place for solitude and relaxation but a close drive into town. The views were absolutely stunning.

I recently stayed at Kirsten's earth ship and it was an incredible experience. The mornings were particularly warm and inviting due to the solar power that heats the space. The greywater recycling system was also a nice touch and added to the overall eco-friendly vibe of the property. The gas stove was a great way to cook meals and the space's overall design was modern, sleek, and comfortable. The location was also perfect, it was a quiet area but still close to Taos which was great for exploring. I highly recommend staying at Kirsten's earth ship, it's a unique and eco-friendly way to experience the Taos area.

Kirsten’s Earthship is so very special. Don’t hesitate on booking this gem. We had an amazing stay at this home, it is such a magical place. Kirsten was a wonderful host, very attentive and responsive, you won’t want for anything staying here.

Great stay at Kirsten's Earthship! Very unique stay in an absolutely beautiful, quiet, and private location. Instructions in the house manual are great and clearly explain how to operate everything. We stayed over the New Year's weekend and it was a lovely way to spend the holiday weekend. (The only thing to note if you're staying in winter is that it can get very cold in the desert. The heaters in the Earthship are propane heaters, which work great for short stints of warming the house, but they cannot be left on at night or for long periods. So pack warm clothes and pj's if you're visiting in winter.) Definitely recommend Kirsten's Earthship if you want a super unique stay with unbeatable views!

Wow! What an incredible place in Taos! Kirsten was a great host, responsible, helpful, and provided us with wonderful recommendations well in advance of our stay. She also provided super clear travel instructions, which helped us as we were driving from out of state.
The earthship itself is out of this world, no pun intended! My husband and I have never stayed at a more unique, and magical place. The stars at night were incredible. The place was clean and had everything we needed. I was shocked at how warm the earthship would stay in the winter. Opening the blinds in the morning and in 30 minutes you’d want to take off your sweater! Crazy!
The earthship is also pretty centrally located so you can get into Taos, Arroyo Seco, the ski valley, and much more in about 20minutes. Worked great for our day to day plans.
Overall, if you’re looking for a peaceful, sustainable, and magical stay for your visit to Taos, I highly recommend booking with Kirsten. It will make your trip!

Surprisingly cozy for the temps outside, 9 degrees at night. As soon as you open the blinds in the am it heats up quick.
Kristen's added touch of coffee half and half and almond milk in the fridge made it extra special. Thank you! Great experience of Earthship living, just what I was looking for.
Kitchen is well equipped and fun to use. Really a very pleasant homely feel, highly recommend it.
Gabriele

This modern earthship on the Taos Mesa is a delight. Get ready for quietude, beauty, and a true learning experience. Kirsten is an incredible hostess and Ron, her other half, is wonderful. Just go ahead and book you will not regret it.
There are very few places as beautiful as Kirsten's Earthship. I will come back as often as I can !

We've stayed in dozens of airbnbs, but this is the most amazing one we've ever been too. The views in and outside the apartment are beautiful, day and night. It's really weird experience because the windows are so tall you feel like you're indoors and outdoors. There is also lots of good hiking in short driving distance. We especially liked the trails around the vista Verda parking area, down in the Rio Grande Canyon. It got down into the low teens (Fahrenheit) several nights of our stay, but was still comfortable inside.
You should definitely visit this spot. hit a couple hikes and then come back to the cozy earth ship and cook a delicious dinner.

We loved our stay at the Earthship! It was quiet, peaceful, and well equipped. We especially appreciated the coffee provided by the host. We would absolutely stay again - the views simply cannot be beat!

I've stayed in a lot of Airbnb's at this point and this was hands down one of the best. The house itself was warm and inviting and had everything we needed. The instructions on usage were clear and we had no issues with the functionality or arrival. The landscape was stunning and overall it was an absolutely peaceful escape. Would highly recommend and hope to stay again!

If you’re looking for a unique experience while in the Taos area, this is it! My wife and I loved our stay here and there’s no shortage of views. Even though this property is off the grid it didn’t feel that way. All the comforts are still there. Highly recommend this place!
Beautiful, unique house, great place to chill , take pictures , enjoy the sky.

I’ve always wanted to stay in an earthship and this was a perfect place. Very impressed by how warm it remained indoors even when it was snowing outside. Love the large windows, we watched the stars from inside every night. Beautiful scenery.

Okay you MUST stay here, period. This home is amazing - sunlight through the front windows makes you feel like you are outside. Inside decor - I fell in love right away, so well decorated. The bed is SOOOO COMFORTABLE, I slept like a baby. The coffee that is provided is such a nice touch. I used the bike to ride around and take pictures of neighboring Earthships, so cool! I honestly loved everything about this house, I felt like the house was alive, never stayed in anything like this. Highly highly recommend this experience!
A fantastic stay and unique experience! Scenery and stars were amazing. Short 20 minute drive to Taos and even closer to Rio Grande Gorge.
Kirsten's place is just as incredible as it looks! Surrounded by beautiful scenery and very comfortable, I highly recommend as a launching pad for exploring Taos and the surrounding area.

I strongly recommend arriving during daylight. We did get lost a little bit. the earthship was absolutely amazing. This vacation was exactly what we needed. We spent hours just staring at the scenery and the night sky. I was concerned with the fact there was no AC or heater. I get bad hot flashes at night and like to sleep in a cold room but once I started playing with the sky lights and vents I slept great! The weather was perfect. Scenery breathtaking. Has everything you need. I had to take a few minutes to say goodbye. We would definitely be coming back. Thank you so much!!

Kirsten’s place was all that we hoped it would be! In addition to being a clean, quiet, safe, place to stay, it provided a lesson in off the grid, sustainable living! We really enjoyed learning about Earthships and getting to stay in one ourselves.
Her place is a short drive from Taos and all that it has to offer, and it also has a full kitchen if you want to stay/cook in. Kristen provides thorough instructions and explanations for anything unique to the Earthship. And the views are spectacular! I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.
We’ve been to Taos many times but this was by far the most unique experience! Beautiful home, setting & good vibes. The perfect accommodations 🏔

We had the best time here! This is such a beautiful location and waking up to the sunrise through those windows is a treat! Kirsten is a phenomenal host - leaving us flowers and chocolates because this stay was part of our honeymoon roadtrip. Kirsten also left us fantastic recommendations for local food and hiking. We would absolutely stay here again.
Stunning. Clean, beautiful, unique and quiet. We had a wonderful stay and Kirsten is such a thoughtful host. We’ll definitely return!

WOW. A truly remarkable experience! All of the comforts of home, while still allowing the chance to experience life off the grid. It's easy to maintain the facilities, the bed was super comfortable, and we cooked for several meals with no issues. The views are gorgeous in all directions! We had a great time and I know we'll be talking about this trip to anyone who'll listen. Do not hesitate to book this home!

When in Rome... or, rather, Taos/El Prado. It's all about the Earthship. Kristen's Earthship is surrounded by all kinds of other Earthships, and it all makes for a unique aesthetic and feel to a stay in the Taos area. Also, the Earthship museum is a 15-minute bike ride (bikes provided by Susan) away from Susan's place -- worth going if you're interested in learning about what all goes into the makings of the place you're staying in. You're about 20 minutes from downtown Taos, but it is worth it if you're looking for quiet, privacy, and a one-of-a-kind stay in New Mexico. Being off-grid is just kind of cool, too, let's face it. Susan's Earthship, which we started referring to as the "Mothership" is plenty big, clean, and it's hard to beat waking up in the morning and looking out over big, tropical green foliage (that's inside), at the wall of windows that reveal the New Mexico landscape and mountains in the distance. It was fun coming home to the Mothership every night, and we'd do it again.

This was just the relaxing, comfortable get away that we needed. We stayed for a full week and it left me wanting an earth ship of my own. Kirsten was easy to get in contact with and provided lots of personal touches. Highly recommend!

This was the first time we’ve ever stayed in an earth ship and I have a feeling it won’t be the last! The structure was so cool. We loved riding the bikes PROVIDED to get a look at a lot of the other earth ships. It was a trip to see. Kirsten was a great host; very responsive and helpful! She even left a bowl of dog treats and a large bowl of water out for our dogs upon arrival. The space is extremely dog-friendly! Instructions were simple and clear. Even though there isn’t AC, the structure stayed comfortable, especially at night and early mornings. Will recommend this earth ship to all my friends! What a fabulous and unique place to stay.

WOW. Grab a camera before you book your stay here. The views at Sunrise are breathtaking. If you're worried about being here during the rainy season, don't fret too much--the panoramic scene with the rain coming in over the mountains will change your mind, plus this home has everything you'd need to stay comfy inside! You're about a 7minute drive to the Rio Grande Bridge(there are souvenir vendors in the parking lot), and about 20min to Taos. The brewery wasn't open from repairs yet, but if you're here in late September, you should be able to stop in for great drinks and scenescapes. You can see EVERY star at night, and you can hear the coyotes too! Great amenities, great location, great views. what else can you ask for?
Amazing visas, unique experience, inspiring place! Hope to return again.

one of the most unique homes I've ever stayed in! it's a great example of how sustainable living can be super comfortable. I barely noticed the fact that the house is off grid. I would recommend this place for a first time stay at an earthship, it was my first time and I loved it

This is an amazing and special place to stay. We loved looking out on the gorgeous view and how quiet it was. The house is well stocked and the experience of staying in an Earthship was really interesting.
It’s in a gorgeous setting, and we enjoyed very much watching the sunrise, sunset and rain. Simple amenities but functional and comfortable. Will highly recommend!

Kristen is a phenomenal host. The instructions and communication leading up to our stay were detail oriented and helpful. She made it clear that she was available if we needed her however wasn’t overbearing in any way. There were so many great little touches around the Airbnb to make our stay more comfortable and she even left out some dog treats for Jelly, our dog.
The Airbnb is one of a kind. Do yourself a favor and book it for a unique but comfortable experience in an incredible location. The Taos Earthship was spotless and tidy when we arrived and navigating the off-grid system was a breeze. Also - there is so much great food and art in Taos as well as hiking around the area - and Kristen has a great little binder full of all of this information for you in the Airbnb.
I would recommend this place to anyone.
Gorgeous location & abode! Highly recommend staying here— about 15-20 minutes to Taos, but entirely worth it to cross the Rio Grande Bridge everyday!

There isn't a whole lot that I can say that hasn't been said in previous reviews. Staying at Kirsten's Earthship was a fantastic experience and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It was serene, beautiful, and the perfect place for a getaway. I also learned a lot about sustainable architecture by watching some Youtube videos about the house as well as Earthships in general. I would recommend doing the same as you will be amazed at what Kirsten done and what a really amazing thing it is to be able to stay in this labor of love. Easily my wife and I's favorite Airbnb experience!

Amazing place which should be on your list if you have even a passing interest in earthships. House has everything you need so you won’t be roughing it despite the eco friendly ethos.
Short drive into Taos across the impressive Rio Grande Gorge Bridge!

We had the best time here! The earthship is so cool and the community/neighborhood is very peaceful. Kristen's home is so close to the Royal Gorge Bridge which made it convenient to enjoy an early morning hike before it got too crowded or hot. The town of Taos was also close so we were able to spend time checking out the Plaza, enjoying dinner, etc.
Kristen was super communicative and helpful! We originally thought we weren't going to arrive until late at night so she left the outside light on for us so that we'd be able to see the house. I definitely recommend arriving when there is still light as it's hard to see the signs at night. Kristen's directions were *super* helpful so if you do come at night, make sure to read them.
We had a great time and hope to visit again soon!
Amazing experience! I was so sad when we had to pack up and leave. Very clean and has everything you need. Beautiful views!!

Such a unique and wonderful stay! Highly recommend this place for anyone who is interested in what it’s like to live off the grid. The building is incredible and a bonus - we had front row seats to jackrabbits playing outside the house!
Wonderful desert getaway! So fun to stay in an earthship.

The earthship community is truly magical to drive into. We immediately felt the wonder and creativity coming from the people who design and build these homes. Check in was very easy, you can park near either door. From the driveway, we parked on the right facing the back of the earthship. The bedroom is over there (for ease of bringing your suitcase in), but the door you'll be able to get in to is the one on the left. Either way, there are stairs. The indoor garden is beautiful, tons of succulents and geranium. Our favorite place in the house was the kitchen. We cooked every meal (stayed 4 nights) and cooking felt like we were at home, very easy. It's stocked with everything you need. We bought groceries at Cid's Food Market, an organic market about 20 minutes away. I recommend the Taos Honey Company raw amber honey if you go there.
This might be a one-off issue, but I may have been allergic to something around us at the earthship. It could have been the dryness, the juniper or maybe the smoke from the devastating fires happening in NM right now. It was my first time in NM and I'm from Georgia (US). It wasn't until my partner and I left the earthship did my allergies ease up (we stayed another 5 days in NM in Ojo Caliente and Albuquerque). We bought some allergy medicine and eye drops at Cid's on our way out of Taos. And though I think they worked, it was expensive and you might want to bring your own if you any of this resonates with you!
If you like living sustainably and are an artist or creative, I recommend staying for a self-organized retreat. It's ultra quiet and there's plenty of space to work.
Great host!

Wonderful remote getaway with all the necessities and comforts you might need. We had no issues finding the place by following Kirsten’s directions. I would definitely try to arrive in daylight though (which we did). The temperature was very comfortable the whole time and the view of the mountains was breathtaking. Would highly recommend staying at this Earthship!
What a wonderful experience. We loved waking up with our dogs to beautiful sunrises. Town was fun but we preferred the refuge of the house. It was a great spot to recharge!

Very cozy place in wonderful setting - Earthship and all the dwellings around .
Yes that New Mexico light was present and the ever changing sky .
Enjoyed our stay !!
We loved our stay here. The design and aesthetics of the space are excellent. Everything worked very well. Extremely comfortable and off the grid !
A fun and unique place to stay. We enjoyed our vacation in Taos very much!
Great place to stay and experience being off the grid. The windows allow for a beautiful sunrise.

This was my second time staying in the earth ship community and it was more amazing than the first time. The place is so beautiful and comfortable. Incredible views and prime location. Thanks so much for having us!
Everything was exactly as promised, nice, clean and comfortable. A great experience!
This stunning earthship is the most beautiful place I’ve stayed on earth! It was way more beautiful in person and the landscape is utterly magnificent. I can’t wait to return!
This Earthship is a beautiful place to reconnect with the land, oneself, and others. Peaceful, serene, and just what we needed!

What a lovely, unique experience staying in Kirsten's earthship! My husband and I worked remotely during our stay and had zero issues with connectivity to WiFi. The views were stunning & the house had everything we could possibly need. Kirsten went above and beyond with small touches such as snacks and fresh flowers. Highly recommend!

It's an incredible out of the box experience, that will be unlike anyplace you've ever stayed before. The simple touches make this place all that more special. I had a wonderful time, and would highly recommend it!

It was a very unique experience . More of an adventure! We loved the earth ship and the nearby town. The house is extremely bright and very quiet. The stars at night are amazing. The host is very friendly and helpful. The nearby town , Taos has cute stores and coffee shops. We had a couple of good dinners at Orlando’s and Antonio’s. I personally liked Antonio’s relaxed atmosphere with very good food. Take out pizza at Taos outback was also very good. There are many hiking trails and the nearby gorge is very beautiful. We went in early spring, the days were mostly warm and sunny. The nights cool. The lack of humidity made even the cool early morning feel warm compared to home. The experience is very unique and worthwhile.

This is the best AirBnB I’ve ever stayed in! The location is incredible, so scenic, and just remote enough to feel removed but also close enough to town if needed. The house itself is very comfortable and has all the things you might need. The host is also very kind, responds quickly, and helpful. Great place overall!

Kirsten’s Earthship was magical! We were comfortable and warm our entire stay. We had zero issues with working any of the Earthship’s features.
Definitely follow Kirsten’s recommendation and eat at Orlando’s Mexican restaurant (be prepared to wait)… it is well worth the wait.
We will definitely be back!!

What a dream. This place was breathtaking at every moment, from seeing the mass of stars at night to the panoramic view of the sunrise, shining over the entire mesa.
The bed was so comfy, couch was large enough for an average sized guest to sleep on, the kitchen and bathroom had all the amenities, fridge was a decent size, water was hot for the first night. The second night the hot water did go out, which the owner informed me is common if its very windy. It’s a very easy fix and she even mentioned she would add this to the directions so you can relight the pilot. The house was warm just from the solar and geothermal even during my visit during the winter. I even had to crack open the skylight/vents at some points.
Kirsten was an incredible, communicative, and generous host.
I could have stayed here for much much longer!
Thank you!
Great stay!!!
Great stay!
A beautifully serene location! House was very clean and well-appointed.
We loved our stay!!! The views were amazing, the bed was so comfortable, and the kitchen had everything we needed to cook all of our meals! We were so cozy here!
Absolutely magnificent! A magical off-grid cozy getaway. Really appreciated the little touches. I was so grateful to experience such a work of art and love and respect for the planet.

100000% perfect. The view brings full wow factor, as well as the experience of staying in The Greater World Community as a whole. Expect that by the end of it you'll end up like my partner and I, plotting your own earthship reality in the nearest as possible future.
Such a sweet stay. Clean and all the amenities you need- we were even surprised with a cheesecake in the fridge for our anniversary 🥰
The only thing we felt was missing was a coat rack- for all our wet ski gear- but that was literally it.
We were cozy & warm on cold nights, even too warm at times during the day, as that structure traps in heat super efficiently.
thank you! would definitely recommend to all.

We had a lovely stay! It was easier to understand how to live in an earthship and make it all work than I thought. It’s all very well set up, easy to use and a beautify place to stay. The internet worked great for getting some work done, as well. We’ll be back!
Had a very nice and relaxing time at Kristen’s earthship. She had everything I needed and the views were incredible!!!

INCREDIBLE!!! One of the coolest places I’ve ever stayed. It’s a beautiful home with the most amazing views of the mountains!! It’s an easy drive into town to the shops and restaurants. We loved staying further out from town and enjoyed the drive everyday!! Kirsten is a fantastic host and even accommodated our early arrival. We had everything we needed in her beautiful earthship home. Can not wait to stay again!!

Incredible stay! It was our first time staying in an Earthship so we did not really know what to expect, but we didn’t want to leave when it was time to check out. The view is so breathtaking and the earthship is well-equipped with everything you could need.
We found ourselves wanting to stay in rather than going out. The skylight above the bed is a nice touch too.
Kirsten was a great host! Very communicative and helpful. We would love to stay at her earthship again. 🌎

This place was absolutely as advertised - beautiful, unique and spotless! We loved every minute of it. The host Kirsten was extremely kind and very communicative every step of the way. She also added some really nice "personal" touches like a little New Year celebration kit for our stay - it's thoughtful acts like that that make AirBNB and these types of hosts so special! This is by far one of the best AirBNBs I have ever stayed at. Highly, highly recommend!!

The Modern Mesa was a fun, unique, beautiful stay just 15 min outside downtown Taos and 35-40 min from Taos Ski Valley. The only reason we have to give 4 instead of 5 stars, is because we travelled during a high wind storm - which caused a loud rattling on the roof right above the sleeping area - that made it nearly impossible to sleep our first night.
The next night was the exact opposite - completely silent and peaceful. We loved the design, dog-friendly aspect, and the amenities. It stayed surprisingly warm and cozy in a winter snow/wind storm.
Kirsten was a wonderful host and communicated well.

Kirsten's Earthship was such an amazing experience! We loved getting to explore the unique neighborhood; it's such an incredible community The house was clean, comfy, and peaceful. Waking up in the morning to the mountain view was surreal. Can't recommend enough!

This place is absolutely amazing… the pictures are 100% accurate. The indoor plants were beautiful, the views were breathtaking, and she (Kirsten) even had a small little cheesecake with a candle because I told her we were booking it for my gfs 30th birthday! The only thing to mention is that since it is an earth ship and off the grid, just make sure to be conscientious of water and power consumption… overall, an easy 5/5 stars from me, would definitely stay again. :)
Super unique stay! We loved the house and the views and everything!
Great place to stay & accurate. Perfect place for a getaway or to stay while exploring the surrounding area
Loved staying in this warm and cozy Earthship! It was easily accessible off the main road yet quite and secluded. Highly recommend.

Don’t think twice, book this place and you will not regret it. The architecture, the quietness, and night sky was magnificent.
Kristen was extremely on top of everything and assisted me when I needed help immediately. Definitely plan to stay here again.

We enjoyed our stay at this unique AirBnB. The location was perfectly situated; close to everything but far enough away to really get away from it all. We couldn’t get over the panoramic views this place offered. Kirsten provided all the comforts of home and left us clear instructions on the simple ways to run an earthship. We will consider staying here again or another one of Kirsten’s earthships!
Great place to stay and explore Taos, or even get some work done. Very clean and well maintained. Would recommend to friends!

I loved this space so much I only left for groceries and even tried to extend my stay! It’s beautiful and so unique! As others said strong WiFi, informative instructions, sun filled and so unique! Beautiful, protected views, but silent inside. Super comfy bed, with the stars right above you! Everything you could need in the kitchen, 20 mins to Taos and a fun drive to Rio del Grande Monument.

Five out of five stars all around. The most amazing place that I’ve ever stayed. It was so beautiful and peaceful. It felt nice to get off the grid a bit and the locals were delighted that we were staying at an Earthship. Kirsten is a great host.

Sunrises Sunsets Stars. Feeling incredible after our stay in Kirstens earthship. The experience of being in a energy independent home gives one the recharge a vacation should. Thoughtful and lovely. Quiet and efficient. Clean and very cool. Dog friendly a plus. Loved the bikes available for use. You will leave inspired to be a better earthling.
Excellent and unique experience - beautifully maintained home with a great landscape to view sunsets..

This earthship is very user friendly! We were impressed with how good the wifi connection was. One note, they don't have a microwave or blow dryer because both would mess up the earthship's electrical systems. It would have been good to know that in advance so I could have left my blow dryer at home!

All we can really say is bravo! This earthship was so comfortable and peaceful. We were so taken back by the views that we didn’t even turn the tv on once! Kirsten communicated everything very well and made it super easy for our first experience staying in an earthship. This place is a must and you will not regret it.

A very unique experience- the interior is so well done and the views are unbeatable. Your closest neighbor is yards away and no city lights reveal the beauty of the stars.
The bed was very comfortable and we appreciated the personal touches and French press! We were very excited to explore what made this community special and it did not disappoint.
One of my all time fav AirBnB experiences. Highly recommend
Hobbit meets New Age. As other reviewers have said, it was a unique and comfortable stay. The indoor garden was lovely. And the sunrises!

We've always been curious about the earthships just outside of Taos, and getting to spend time in Kirsten's is like staying inside a work of art. It's spotless, completely private, perfectly appointed, beautifully situated (so much sky! unimaginably beautiful views!). It's the perfect place for a peaceful retreat, and I can't recommend it highly enough.

We thoroughly enjoyed this amazing location and home, which has been so carefully built and outfitted by the hosts. We arrived in an unusually early snow storm for Taos, and freaked a little about whether the home would be warm. Kristen immediately helped us know how to pull down the blinds, and to understand the theory behind heating and cooling the house. And, we were very warm and comfortable. The views are spectacular. Kristen left so many nice comforts of home too. All and all - we highly recommend staying here!.
Truly a unique stay the landscape is beautiful a great location to watch the sunrise and take in the stars at night.

Amazing and totally unique spot! Earthships are incredible and this view could not be beat. Minor cons of this place: It is at least about 20 min from town. Skylight over bed makes it very bright in morning so not the place for sleeping in. No microwave/toaster and oven was hard to use. Apple TV spotty. Overall fantastic stay though, highly recommend!

Kirsten’s Earth ship is a real standout - from the gentle curve of the windows to the gorgeous view to the amazing indoor garden. This is the one you want - and very accurate to the photos. Kirsten provided some snacks and everything we needed, as well as went above and beyond to answer questions and curiosities. If you’re considering this place, book it.
Had a great stay! Beautiful home and community. I would highly recommend and will definitely return!
This Earth ship was absolutely incredible. Truly organic living. The space was very calming and really brings clarity to you. Will be staying again soon.
Comfortable and spacious accommodation. Such a unique experience and responsive host. One of a kind.
Wonderful earthship experience. Great directions for everything! Views of New Mexico sky were fantastic.
This is, hands down, one of the best AirBnb experiences we’ve had. The Earthship itself is a marvel and the location can’t be beat. We loved every minute of it and can’t wait to return!
This place is truly a unique stay in a gorgeous setting! We enjoyed our stay very much, and Kirsten’s communication was awesome.

This is such a unique space! We had a great time - just a 20 minute drive to Taos and so peaceful! Not knowing too much about Earthships, we were a little hesitant that house might require a 30 page instruction manual to operate - but there really wasn't anything complicated. It really was effortless! The instructions (which were few) were straightforward and easy to understand ! We would definitely stay here again!

Fun and different and an overall excellent experience. A great place for stargazing! If/when I ever stay there again I'll bring a telescope.
Pay attention to the suggestions in the house manual on how to best regulate the house temp.
Thanks Kirsten!
Perfect place for us on this kidless trip. Met every expectation and then some. Highly recommend this kind of place, if it suits ur fancy. Perfect launch pad to see all this area has to offer.
I got this reservation and as a gift for my parents and Kristin could not have been a better and sweeter host in making sure they had a great stay. My parents had a great time!

Kirsten's place was so cool! GPS didn't quite work, but Kirsten sent over directions that were really helpful. Everything was clean, bed was comfy, and sunrises were phenomenal. Really enjoyed this stay!
We loved everything about our unique earth ship stay & are grateful to Kirsten and Ron for making this little slice of eco heaven available!

This home is absolutely stunning both inside and out. They have put so much care and consideration into paying respect to our Earth as well as making it very comfortable for those staying here. The views are incredible and the sunsets are magnificent. I highly recommend this home and Kirsten!
Such a lovely, unique and relaxing location. Highly recommend this spot to anyone looking to unplug and enjoy the beauty of New Mexico. We can’t wait yo go back!

We enjoyed and relished every single detail from the views, the solitude, the hot air balloons, the comfortable bed and couch to learning about the fascinating mechanisms of running an earthship. It is a special place.
Great place for a weekend get away for two!
Awesome Earthship stay! So unique!
A unique house with an amazing view close to Taos.

A beautiful and tranquil location on the Mesa with views all around. The house stayed comfortable in peak summer following the hosts instructions. Taos is still accessible via a 15 min drive. A great place to stay if you want more space and connection with nature.

Kirsten’s place is so magical. Beautiful house, beautiful views. My pup and I loved staying here and I really enjoyed learning about earth ship houses. What a cool experience and lovely, comfortable stay.
Really unique stay at this earth ship. Enjoyed our time there; the property was clean, spacious, and and the directions were clear. Highly recommended experience.

This property is the epitome of peace and quiet. Includes gorgeous views and a well maintained, unique property. Anyone interested in knowing more about earthships will be fascinated.
Kirsten was a great host. She answered all our questions and met our special needs within an hour.

This is a fascinating place. It was very comfortable and well appointed. The sunset and full moon rising were magical. We learned a lot about environmentally sustainable building design from this experience. We would definitely return.

Kirsten’s place is absolutely magical. We turned off (even though you don’t have to- there’s WiFi and television available) and enjoyed the solitude for a few days. The place is about twenty minutes outside of town, so it’s a perfect distance to visit Taos but still feel like you’re in the middle of nowhere. Her place was clean and easy to check in. We loved staying here!

We had a wonderful stay at the earthship. It was a unique experience. The landscape and outdoors was very spacious. Sitting outside for sunset was an enjoyable part of our day. The garden and plant life inside was magnificent. While we didn’t use them, there were two bikes there for exploring. Skylights we’re also very cool. Location was about 15 mins from el prado, but we didn’t mind the drive to restaurants and shops because it was worth it for the expansive views.
great stay! great host! thanks!
Such an amazing experience! Couldn’t recommend this place enough. Kirsten is such a thoughtful host!
What an incredible place! Loved every minute. Thanks!

I had a fantastic time staying in Kirsten's earthship. The view of the Sangre de Christos is amazing. The bed is comfy, and the kitchen is well-stocked with everything you need. It was a perfect place to relax and recharge. Super cool experience all-around.
Awesome place with good amenities and great views!

Wonderful space and we can't recommend enough! Absolutely stunning views, space, and communication with Kirsten. Such a cool experience to stay at the Earthship and see how the community lives and yet a very easy drive to/from Taos. I would HIGHLY recommend this experience to other travelers!
Coolest Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in no hyperbole.
Kristen's place was beautiful, very well taken care of, and her tips and information about her lovely Earthship and local recreation was much appreciated.

Staying at the Skybox was a dream come true. Everything about the stay was easy, relaxing, and comfortable. Sean was a responsive and accommodating host. I look forward to returning to this Airbnb anytime I am in the area.
Great stay!

A place like no other. Silent and relaxing with amazing views in every direction.

Would highly recommend anyone looking to spend a few days in the beautiful high desert of northern NM to book this place! Sean is an incredible host and his vacation listing is absolutely perfect!

Two old somewhat hippies from Medina, Ohio. We have been in the Taos area numerous times and just love the town and the local culture. Wanted to be out on the high plateau and just experience the wind, mountains and sky! It did not disappoint. Almost full moon one night and a ring of rain storms the next. We loved it and highly recommend it!
Spotless and really pretty inside. Comfy bed, good pillows, good water pressure. Overall, the communication was great, super easy to get in (just a lockbox code) and we really enjoyed our stay.
Really enjoyed my time at skybox. It’s a wonderful spot to connect intimately with nature. Super peaceful. As for the inside: the bed was comfy, the shower pressure was great.

This place is great! The place is every bit as stunning as the photos make you believe. What can’t be captured in photos is how quiet and peaceful it is. I would just stand hearing nothing but birds. No noise from the outside world. Just peace.
Was able to some star photography and enjoy Taos at same time.
Loved the skybox. A lot of amenities (dishwasher, washer, dryer) in addition to the views made this a grea stay.
Beautiful relaxing stay, exactly as described. This is the perfect place for a weekend getaway.
The Skybox was beautiful and the stars were absolutely amazing! The entire area was everything we envisioned and more, I would definitely come back and stay again!

I will always choose the skybox for my stay. Sean continues to be responsive and provide outstanding service. If you’re looking for a quiet place to unwind, take in the sunsets and stars, this is the place. See you again soon!
We very much enjoyed our stay! Great location with spectacular views. Communication was very helpful, clear and timely.
This space was wonderful! My favorite part was drinking coffee on the deck in the morning and just staring at the high desert.

We loved Sean’s place. My husband said as we were leaving “I would stay here again”.

Gorgeous & peaceful spot. Enjoyed sitting out on the patio watching the mountains & stars. There is another skybox nearby so you'll see your neighbors but it doesn't detract from the serene environment.

Oh man, what a gorgeous place! If you`re looking for the most beautiful view with dark skies to see the stars, and have 100 mile visibility in all directions, this is your place. The place is small but they`ve got cute design elements that made the house feel very comfortable. The bed was cumfy, the heating air-conditioning was easy to use and worked well. Would stay here if ever coming back to Taos. The nearby restaurants were awesome.

amazing view. quiet. near great restaurant “medley”

This property is all about the views, which are stunning. Sunrise in the morning from bed or lounge, sunset at night from the corner of the deck or watching alpenglow creep down the mountains. It's about twenty minutes from Taos proper, and it's a beautiful drive out along the ridges and through the sagebrush. Starwatching is also excellent: there's little light pollution if you can catch it on a cloudless night. And the place is very comfortable: the bed is good (though the pillows a little hard), the furnishings comfortable (though the cowhide chair shedded all over us - ha!), the aesthetic contemporary in a SW way. Deck & deck chairs were awesome! Only downsides: the dishwasher was a little finicky, there were some oily pots and pans, and the surfaces weren't as clean as we'd like (we had nothing to sanitize surfaces with). The bedding and towels had a few stains but were clean. And the living room lighting was harsh--cold "day" light, so tough to wind down at night.
Beautiful place and great hosts!

Sean’s place was the best of both worlds for chasing a winter storm at the ski valley. Stargazer is a quaint and cozy retreat where you feel away from it all but are in close proximity to shopping, provisions, restaurants and outdoor activities. The view alone is worth every penny.

Our stay at the Skybox was wonderful. We wanted to stay in a remote locale with the stars and sage brush as our landscape - as advertised!
The area does appear to be growing with more development.

Check in and check out were detailed with no fuss. We were very pleased with the Skybox in Taos.
Outdoor views were amazing and the location was not what I expected but very pleased.

Sean's place was as magical and as nice as described. Perfectly rated property. Sean was very clear and helpful with instructions which created a fluid start to finish process. Mini kitchen exceed expectations, water pressure strong and enough utensils and kitchenware for anything. Sean is a professional and this airbnb felt professional. Comfortable bedding / perfect water pressure and temp.

Hands down one of the most gorgeous places I have ever had the fortune of staying! Beautiful home with amazing views of the mountains and stars (when it wasn't snowing!). This tiny house had everything we needed - the kitchen was well stocked and there was plenty of bedding. A really nice getaway.

Perfect long weekend thanks to stylish, comfortable digs and unmatched serenity. That view, morning and evening, was head-clearing and soul-filling.

So perfect!! Really beautiful sunsets and great views. We loved our stay! Great distance from Taos and private.
